intro: Gerascanthus vulgaris, commonly known as the common gerascant, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Gerascanthus vulgaris is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
